avalancheActivity.comment:
Thursday: In some localities light snowfall to low altitudes. This applies in particular in the regions of the north exposed to the foehn wind as well as along the border with France and along the border with Switzerland.
On Wednesday small wind slabs formed adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls as well as at high altitude. On Thursday these will increase in size additionally. These avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are therefore barely recognisable. They can be released, even by a single winter sport participant, especially on very steep slopes. Even a small avalanche can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
Loose snow avalanches are possible as the day progresses, but they can reach medium size in isolated cases. This applies in particular on extremely steep slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The weather will be cold. The fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Wednesday: At the border to France and along the border with Switzerland 15 to 25 cm of snow fell. The northwesterly wind has transported the new snow. The wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack.
As a consequence of falling temperatures the snowpack consolidated during the last two days. Towards its surface, the snowpack is hard and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust. Significant decrease in danger of moist and wet avalanches.
Above approximately 2300 m a lot of snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
On Wednesday small wind slabs formed in particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 2 (moderate), especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas. These can in isolated cases be released, even by a single winter sport participant. This applies in particular on extremely steep slopes especially at intermediate and high altitudes. Even a small avalanche can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
Individual loose snow avalanches are possible as the day progresses, but they will be mostly small. This applies in particular on extreme slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The weather will be cold. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Wednesday: Above approximately 2000 m 0 to 5 cm of snow fell. The wintry weather conditions gave rise to consolidation of the old snowpack in all aspects. Significant decrease in danger of moist and wet avalanches.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is hard and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust.

Above approximately 2300 m a lot of snow is lying.
